title: Julian Gerner to retain and develop Sorrento's Continental Hotel
text:
Hotelier Julian Gerner has ended months of uncertainty about the fate of Sorrento's Continental Hotel after striking a deal to retain the Mornington Peninsula landmark venue and complete a $100 million project on the site.

After the failure this year of developer Steller, which abandoned an $80 million redevelopment of the Continental in May, Mr Gerner struck a deal in September to sell it to another developer, Demetrios Charisiou's LBA Capital, for $21 million.

A giant hole is next to the Continental Hotel. Eamon Gallagher

However, LBA Capital, which had its assets frozen by the courts following a dispute with its South Korean-based financiers, failed to settle on the Continental Hotel, as was widely expected.

On Thursday, Mr Gerner said he had negotiated an agreement to retain the 143-year-old sandstone hotel and to "deliver on the vision to restore, renovate, protect and preserve" it.

"A comprehensive and compelling investment information memorandum is being finalised and I am confident that required funding will be secured imminently," he said.
